TopicTitle: Kerbals ? What are they made of ??

Articles.Content:
Seeing that a kerbal can comfortably survive re-entry as well as falls from 1000's of meters...

What are they made of ?

Are they a silicon life form ??

Edited September 7, 2013 by Lohan2008

Based on a description of a rather interesting part:

name = kethane_kerbalBlender

title = KE-WAITNONOSTOP-01 Kerbal Unreconstitutionator

description = In an effort to "go green", OKEP engineers devised a method to extract Kethane from a readily available and fully renewable resource. While low in mass, these (sometimes) brave Kerbonauts have a high energy density, yielding a not insignificant quantity of Kethane. Warranty void if used on Jebediah.

Kethane, I think. They are green after all, aren't they? (just joking, I have no idea what chemical components are they based on. Something completely different from us, as even the water on Kerbin is WAY more dense than H2O)
Isn't it simple? They're made of the right stuff.

I'm fairly sure they are Karbon based life forms.

I think they have a high Gameplayium content too, which is a similar element to Narrativium (which is interestingly absent from the Kerbalverse so far).
Well, I don't think surviving reentry is special - it is only visual after all. I, however, believe that they are made of Karbon groups and phlebotinum, and rubber. They're quite bouncy after all.
Made from 100% Badass
Rubber, especially the astronaut suits.

I'm fairly sure they are Karbon based life forms.

I think they have a high Gameplayium content too, which is a similar element to Narrativium (which is interestingly absent from the Kerbalverse so far).

Currently reading Science of Discworld IV. That made me chuckle.

Isn't it simple? They're made of the right stuff.

Ouch. That's so bad it burns.

They seem to mostly be made of dust; that's all that comes out when they plow into a wall at speed and die.
It's the best I could come up with on 4 hours of sleep
It's simple. One word: Plastics.

Isn't it simple? They're made of the right stuff.
Made from 100% Badass

These. So true. The Badass right stuff!

It's simple. One word: Plastics.

I play Civ so I know what that means
Kerbals are fungi. Upon death, they pop like puffballs, releasing millions of spores.
The K gene in their KNA defines them.
Geschosskopf, I think you are close. I think they are made of green cheese.
They are teflon. they squish.
they are made out of flubber

they are made out of flubber

OH. YES. of course!

Falls from thousands of meters, I don't think so. I just killed Bill from a fall at 2500m. He went "puff" onto the surface of MÃƒÂ¼n during a rescue mission to save him. His forward velocity may have had something to do with it as well.

I have dropped them off the top of the rocket they were once sitting it at the launch pad a hundred meters onto the ground without issues. I was worried the first time but turns out they're like bumbles. Because everyone knows bumbles bounce.
They are kerbanite life forms.
They're made of green sponge cake. Duh.
Green Ballistics Gel. That is why they can with stand a hit from plane or a spacecraft.

I'm fairly sure they are Karbon based life forms.

Awww, you beat me to it!
Green Goo - It's like grey goo, but it manages not to consume the world by having an insane craving for explosions.

kranium?

maybe?
